The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #22186 (build, qt: Fix compiling qt package in depends with GCC 11 by hebasto)
* #22142 ([WIP] build: split depends Qt into native and target builds by fanquake)
* #21420 (build, qt: No longer need to patch translation.pro by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>

> How do I test this?

E.g., compiling with depends on ARM (see #18536).

While looking at the Qt source code I found that the original issue is solved in Qt 5.15 (see https://github.com/qt/qttools/commit/9e6943370585bdc791caae6c83555b3aa5efe063).

So just waiting for bumping the Qt version in depends to 5.15.x could be an option.

Updated 6aaef5db59f9f43d032ee7336b2d48df92d8bb90 -> d3fb790093a765cf2114cb1d732e0066c54772a1 ([pr21589.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21589.02) -> [pr21589.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21589.03)):

- rebased on top of the recent build system changes
- add [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21589#issuecomment-833381710) about ability to drop the patch after bumping Qt in depends to 5.15

Where does this commit come from?

```bash
# git remote -v
origin	https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtbase.git (fetch)
origin	https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtbase.git (push)

# git branch --contains 9e6943370585bdc791caae6c83555b3aa5efe063
error: no such commit 9e6943370585bdc791caae6c83555b3aa5efe063
```

If I look for one of the actual deprecation commits i.e [82d02b7b95908dec16e41c5af1c63579729c589b](https://codereview.qt-project.org/gitweb?p=qt%2Fqtbase.git;a=commit;h=82d02b7b95908dec16e41c5af1c63579729c589b):
```bash
# git branch --contains 82d02b7b95908dec16e41c5af1c63579729c589b
  5.15
  5.15.0
  5.15.1
  5.15.2
  6.0
  6.0.0
  6.1
  dev
```
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@
+Qt lrelease tool depends on XML features.
+No need to build the libQt5Xml module if tools are
+bootstrapped, even if not cross-compiling.
+
+We should be able to drop this once we are using Qt 5.15:
+ - QTBUG-76177
+ - upstream commit: 9e6943370585bdc791caae6c83555b3aa5efe063

body:
Thanks for checking!
Sorry, I don't know what was in my clipboard at that time :man_facepalming: 

Indeed, you are pointing at the right commit https://github.com/qt/qtbase/commit/82d02b7b95908dec16e41c5af1c63579729c589b
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@
+Qt lrelease tool depends on XML features.
+No need to build the libQt5Xml module if tools are
+bootstrapped, even if not cross-compiling.
+
+We should be able to drop this once we are using Qt 5.15:
+ - QTBUG-76177
+ - upstream commit: 9e6943370585bdc791caae6c83555b3aa5efe063

body:
Updated d3fb790093a765cf2114cb1d732e0066c54772a1 -> 3d92cc45b30ebef4ca3af7cc02f3a7e703e81653 ([pr21589.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21589.03) -> [pr21589.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr21589.04), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr21589.03..pr21589.04)):

- addressed @fanquake's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21589#discussion_r630662364)
[Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21589#issuecomment-839582392).
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@
+Qt lrelease tool depends on XML features.
+No need to build the libQt5Xml module if tools are
+bootstrapped, even if not cross-compiling.
+
+We should be able to drop this once we are using Qt 5.15:
+ - QTBUG-76177
+ - upstream commit: 9e6943370585bdc791caae6c83555b3aa5efe063

Could the "22.0" milestone be assigned to this PR?

> Could the "22.0" milestone be assigned to this PR?

NACK. After thinking about this more, I don't want to go down this path of continually hacking up Qt. I've got some changes that I'll draft PR shortly, which should remove the need for this, and some of your other open PRs, while fixing the same issues they are trying to fix.
For now, I'm going to close this in favour of #22142. If, for some reason, we can't get that change done fairly shortly, I'll reopen this PR.
